rules: Rule1: Either the tourist visited the national park or the tourist enjoyed the organic meal.
Rule2: If the tourist found wild mushrooms, then when it is not the case that the tourist tasting local berries follows from visiting the national park, the tourist did not get lost.
Rule3: In case the tourist found edible plants, then if it is false that visiting the national park leads to tasting local berries, the tourist was not lost.
Rule4: Whenever the tourist joined the foraging group, the tourist found wild mushrooms.
Rule5: Either the tourist joined the foraging group or the tourist joined the botany tour.
Rule6: The tourist finding edible plants is a consequence of joining the botany tour.
Rule7: Under the condition that the tourist skipped the park, it is not the case that the tourist visited the national park.
Rule8: The tourist skipped the park or the tourist skipped the forest.
Rule9: If the tourist admired the local sculpture, the tourist did not miss the art exhibit.
Rule10: The tourist visiting the gallery follows from attending the art show.
Rule11: The tourist attended the art show or the tourist attended the craft market.
Rule12: Whenever the tourist attended the craft market, the tourist admired the local sculpture.
Rule13: Either the guide guided the hiking tour or the guide guided the nature walk.
Rule14: Under the condition that the guide guided the nature walk, then if the tourist visited the national park, the tourist tasted local berries.
Rule15: The tourist purchased the guidebook or the tourist purchased the map.
Rule16: If the tourist purchased the map, then whenever the guide guided the hiking tour, the tourist visiting the national park leads to tasting local berries.
Rule17: In case the tourist attended the cooking class, then the purchase of the guidebook ensures that the guide's hiking tour implies that national park visitation results in berry tasting.
Rule18: Either the tourist attended the cooking class or the tourist attended the food demo.
Rule19: The tourist attending the food demo means that purchasing the guidebook leads to the hiking tour guidance entailing that park visits cause berry tasting.
Rule20: Provided that the tourist photographed the landscape, then the tourist shared photos.
Rule21: If it is not the case that visiting the national park leads to tasting local berries, then the tourist got lost.
Rule22: If it is not true that skipping the forest results in not visiting the national park, then the tourist missed the art exhibit.
Rule23: Whenever it is not the case that guidebook purchase implies hiking tour guidance leading to park visits causing berry tasting, the tourist photographed the landscape.
facts: Fact1: The tourist did not share photos.
Fact2: The tourist did not taste local berries.
Fact3: It is not the case that the tourist visited the gallery.

question: The tourist enjoyed the organic meal.
